name: Old Time Hymns Quiz | Christian Music | 15 Questions

questions.text: What famous hymn was written by, John Newton, a former slave trader?
questions.explanation:
'Amazing Grace'.

	Newton went from slave trader to preacher after being lost at sea for almost a month. After that experience he wrote Amazing Grace.

questions.text: Albert Brumley wrote, 'Some glad morning when this life is oe'r I'll' do this?
In this old hymn, what type of memories 'flood my soul'?
Who wrote the 'Battle Hymn of the Republic'?
questions.explanation:
Julia Ward Howe.

	Howe wrote the hymn during the 'War Between the States' in 1862.

questions.text: To what church did Dr. William Pitts tell us to 'come, come, come'?
William Bradbury is credited with writing the music for what famous children's hymn in 1862?
Which of these hymns has the same title as a rock song which talks about a bullfrog that has the same name as an Old Testament prophet?
questions.explanation:
'Joy to the World'.

	Jeremiah was the bullfrog.

questions.text: What traditional spiritual has the phrase, 'See the little baby, lyin' in a manger'?
How is Jesus said to be calling 'for you and for me' in this hymn written by Will Thompson in 1882?
What song begins with the lyrics, 'I'm satisfied with just a cottage below'?
questions.explanation:
'Mansion over the Hilltop'.

	Ira Stanphill wrote this classic in 1949.

questions.text: What famous hymn writer became blind as a small child when a physician gave her the wrong medicine?
questions.explanation:
Fanny Crosby.

	Some of her songs include, 'To God be the Glory', 'Tell Me the Story of Jesus', 'Jesus Keep Me Near the Cross', and 'I am Thine O Lord'.

questions.text: What reformer wrote 'A Mighty Fortress is Our God'?
According to this Johnson Oatman hymn, what should you count when you are tossed 'upon life's billows'?
Who does Andrae Crouch say we will see 'soon and very soon'?
questions.explanation:
The King.

	This lively spiritual was written by Andrae Crouch in 1976.
